title: Quiz 6: Medical-Surgical Nursing (Sept 2022 FQE)
topicName: Medical Surgical Nursing FQE PastPapers Collection
description: Final Qualifying Examination from September 2022 covering general nursing, physiology, and emergency care.

questions.question: When applying the abdominal examination technique, the correct sequence is:
questions.explanation: For the abdomen, Auscultation follows Inspection (IAPP) to avoid altering bowel sounds through palpation/percussion.

questions.question: The synthesis of proteins in a bacterium cell occurs in:
questions.explanation: Ribosomes are the site of protein synthesis in all cells.

questions.question: The size of the pupils of the eye influence accommodation by:

options.text: Dilating when the light is bright
Bending light rays from a distant object
Constricting when the light is bright

questions.explanation: Pupils constrict in bright light to limit light entry and sharpen focus.

questions.question: Adult cardiopulmonary resuscitations (CPR) by two rescuers is achieved by performing:
questions.explanation: The standard adult CPR ratio is 30:2 regardless of the number of rescuers.

questions.question: Potential complications following appendectomy include:

options.text: Peritonitis, peptic ulcer, acute retention of urine

questions.explanation: Common complications are infection (abscess/peritonitis) and bowel paralysis (ileus).

questions.question: A non-infectious skin condition characterized by inflammatory lesions and well defined large adherent silvery scale is:
questions.explanation: Psoriasis presents with silvery scales on erythematous plaques.

questions.question: Myasthenia gravis is a condition that occurs due to:

options.text: Lack of transmission of nerve impulses to muscle fibers
Increased transmission of nerve impulses the basal ganglia

questions.explanation: It is an autoimmune blockade of Acetylcholine receptors, preventing muscle contraction.

questions.question: After retrograde pyelogram a patient should take plenty of fluids in order to:

options.text: Flush the bladder and prevent urinary stasis
Facilitate the examination of the urinary bladder

questions.explanation: Fluids flush out the contrast dye and prevent stasis/infection.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding heart physiology is TRUE?

options.text: The 'dup' sound occurs due to the closure of atrioventricular valves.
The heart is able to generate its own electrical impulses independently of nervous control.

questions.explanation: The heart has automaticity (SA node). 'Dup' is caused by semilunar valve closure, not AV valves.
questions.hint: The heart beats on its own.

questions.question: One of the common causes of sensorineural hearing impairment is:
questions.explanation: Ototoxic drugs damage the inner ear nerve cells (sensorineural). The others affect conduction.

questions.question: The clinical manifestation of Parkinson's disease includes:

options.text: Fatigue, jaundice, numbness, difficulties in coordinating and loss of balance
Cholera, intellectual decline, emotional disturbance, fatigue and loss of postural reflexes
Numbness, muscular rigidity, loss of balance, fatigue, tremors and loss of vision
Impaired movement, muscular rigidity, tremors, muscle weakness and loss of postural reflex

questions.explanation: Parkinson's Triad: Tremor, Rigidity, Bradykinesia (impaired movement).

questions.question: A common complication of tension pneumothorax is:

options.text: Pleurisy due friction of the two membranes
Accumulation of blood and air in the pleural space
Paradoxical chest movement which leads to severe distress
Shifting of the heart and other mediastinal structures to the opposite side

questions.explanation: Mediastinal shift is the hallmark of tension pneumothorax, compressing the healthy lung.
questions.hint: Everything gets pushed to the other side.

questions.question: The inflammation of the iris, ciliary body and the choroid plexus is known as:
questions.explanation: These structures make up the Uvea; inflammation is Uveitis.

questions.question: Adequate intake of vitamin K in diet will prevent:
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is needed to synthesize Prothrombin (clotting factor).

questions.question: One of the complications of excess aldosterone in circulation is:
questions.explanation: Aldosterone retains Sodium/Water (causing high BP) and excretes Potassium.

questions.question: Complicated wound healing presents with the following characteristics:

options.text: Slough, increase in wound size, pus discharge
Increase in wound size, slough, oedema

questions.explanation: Pus and increasing size are signs of infection/complication.

questions.question: The non-opioid drug administered for pain management as per WHO pain management ladder is:
questions.explanation: Step 1 drugs are Non-opioids like Paracetamol and NSAIDs.

questions.question: Wallace scoring of an adult who has sustained burns on one leg (anteriorly) and the genitalia is approximately:
questions.explanation: Anterior leg (9%) + Genitalia (1%) = 10%.

questions.question: Primary dysmenorrhea occurs due to:

richContent.content: Note: Primary dysmenorrhea has no structural pathology. It is chemical.

questions.explanation: Excessive prostaglandins cause severe uterine contractions.

questions.question: A nursing diagnosis development for a patient immediately post-operatively under general anesthesia is:

options.text: Risk for urinary retention related to catheterization
Acute pain related to surgical intervention
Anxiety related to complications of general anesthesia
Ineffective airway clearance related to depressed respiratory function

questions.explanation: Airway (ABC) is the highest priority immediately post-op.

questions.question: Hair loss in patients undergoing chemotherapy is referred to as:
questions.explanation: Alopecia is the term for hair loss.
questions.hint: Starts with A, but not Ataxia.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding gastrointestinal procedures is TRUE?

options.text: Vagotomy is a surgical procedure done on a patient with peptic ulcer disease
Hiatus hernia is repaired by wearing constricting clothes

questions.explanation: Vagotomy cuts the vagus nerve to reduce acid. Constricting clothes worsen hiatus hernia.

questions.question: Drug that is commonly associated with ototoxicity and nephrotoxicity is:
questions.explanation: Gentamycin (Aminoglycoside) is famous for damaging ears and kidneys.

questions.question: The most accurate indicator for fluid loss in an acutely sick patient is:
questions.explanation: Daily weight is the gold standard for fluid status monitoring.

questions.question: Menorrhagia of unknown origin normally affects:
questions.explanation: Blood loss leads to anemia (low hemoglobin).

questions.question: After cataract surgery, the patient is instructed to:

options.text: Lie in the prone position while sleeping
Strengthen eye muscles by chewing hard food
Maintain bed rest for two weeks
Avoid bending head below the waist.

questions.explanation: Bending lowers the head and raises intraocular pressure.

questions.question: Tetany is a classic characteristic manifestation of:
questions.explanation: Low calcium causes muscle twitching and spasms (tetany).

questions.question: Digoxin is classified under the following drugs:
questions.explanation: It is a digitalis glycoside.

questions.question: The detection of sudden increase in blood pH is detected by:
questions.explanation: Buffers react immediately to pH changes.

questions.question: The most suitable procedure done on a patient with organophosphate poisoning is:
questions.explanation: Wash out the stomach (lavage) to remove the poison.

questions.question: The moral principle in nursing which depicts an action as right or wrong is:
questions.explanation: Ethics is the broader study of right/wrong.

questions.question: Absorption of Vitamin B12 occurs in the:
questions.explanation: Specifically in the Ileum (part of the small intestine).
questions.hint: The last part of the small bowel.

questions.question: Shock caused by loss of excessive fluids is:
questions.explanation: Hypo (low) volemic (volume).

questions.question: The purpose of performing abdominal paracentesis is:
questions.explanation: It drains ascites to relieve pressure.

questions.question: The micro-organism that causes dental caries is:
questions.explanation: Strep mutans is the cavity causer.
questions.hint: Mutans mutates your teeth (just a mnemonic).

questions.question: The main three areas of assessment using Glasgow Coma Scale are:

options.text: Vital signs, best verbal, best eye opening
Best verbal, best motor, best eye opening
Best motor, best vital signs, best eye opening
Best limb movement, best verbal, best eye opening.

questions.explanation: EVM: Eye, Verbal, Motor.

questions.question: The causative organism of syphilis is:
questions.explanation: It's a spirochete called Treponema.

questions.question: The uniform and correct balance of internal environment is called:
questions.explanation: Homeostasis or Equilibrium.

questions.question: The main purpose of administering atropine pre-operatively is:

options.text: To dry secretions in the airway

questions.explanation: It dries up secretions.

questions.question: The lobe of the brain that is responsible for sight is:
questions.explanation: Occipital = Optical.

questions.question: Match the part of the tooth with its description:
questions.explanation: Structure: Enamel > Dentin > Pulp. Gums surround the base.

questions.question: Select the risk factors for Cerebral Vascular Accidents (Stroke):
questions.explanation: HTN, Smoking, Diabetes, Obesity are major risks.

questions.question: Match the type of Sickle Cell Crisis with its description:
questions.explanation: Vaso-occlusive = Pain. Sequestration = Pooling. Aplastic = No production.

questions.question: Select the common side effects of cytotoxic (chemotherapy) drugs:
questions.explanation: Chemo targets fast growing cells: Hair follicles, Gut lining (Nausea), Bone Marrow.

questions.question: Which of the following are ethical concepts in nursing practice?
questions.explanation: Standard principles: Autonomy, Beneficence, Non-maleficence, Justice, Veracity.
questions.hint: Doing good, avoiding harm, respecting choice.

questions.question: Arrange the steps in the pathophysiology of an asthma attack:
questions.explanation: Trigger -> Inflammation -> Spasm -> Mucus -> Blockage.

questions.question: Which activities occur during the Planning Phase of the Nursing Process?
questions.explanation: Planning involves setting goals and choosing interventions. Administering is Implementation.

questions.question: What are the indications for Hemodialysis?
questions.explanation: Dialysis is for severe kidney failure complications: Acidosis, Electrolytes (K+), Intoxication, Overload, Uremia (AEIOU).

questions.question: Case Study: Mrs. Ace, 24, admitted with Ruptured Ectopic Pregnancy. Which of the following are appropriate for her management?

richContent.content:
Emergency Case

Patient: Mrs. Ace, 24 yrs.
Diagnosis: Ruptured Ectopic Pregnancy.
Condition: Emergency.

options.text: Immediate resuscitation with IV fluids and blood transfusion
Administration of Anti-D immunoglobulin if Rh negative
Monitoring for signs of shock (tachycardia, hypotension)

questions.explanation: Ruptured ectopic is a surgical emergency requiring shock management (fluids/blood) and surgery. Patient should be NPO for surgery, not taking oral fluids.
questions.hint: Treat shock and prepare for surgery.
